in a company blog post that the decade-old Google troika of himself, Mr. Page and Mr. Eric Schmidt had worked well in guiding the company to its current perch atop search and growing power elsewhere. But he added: We have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. More informally, Mr. Eric Schmidt delivered this message on Twitter: "Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!"

So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making, Eric Schmidt said in a posting on the company's official blog. The surprise shake-up announced Thursday appears to be driven by Eric Schmidt 's desire to assume more of a behind-the-scenes role as much as Page's personal ambition. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt wrote on his Twitter account moments after Google Inc. dropped the bombshell that upstaged its fourth-quarter earnings.
